Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2010 04:49PM CindyC9437 wrote: Hi photobug, I honestly used nothing I took to the hospital.  I had uni mx with lat dorsi reconstruction.  My surgery was at 8:30 am on a Friday and I was released by 10:00 am on Saturday.  so really not much time to settle in.  I had a few visitors on Friday night.  I was coherent for them, but I didn't feel like I needed to entertain them.  Definitely appreciated the visitors after I got home and was feeling a little better and wasn't in a lovely hospital gown. Good luck to you.  I found through this whole process that people want to feel useful to YOU.  I would normally have a hard time with that, but realized it made them feel better about what was going on with me so I just sat back and enjoyed it.  Thoughts will be with you. Cindy
Posts.Title: While in the Hospital photobug Diane509

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2010 08:07PM CindyC9437 wrote: Hello everyone.  I'd like to become your Stage 1 sister!  I had right mx on 3/5 with SNB and immediate lat flap reconstruction.  Doing pretty well and will get one of my 2 drains out tomorrow.  I am most excited about that.  Will see my oncologist for first time in a few weeks so am anxious to see where I go from there but am happy to be on way to being cancer free.  The support from these boards is amazing and I am so thrilled to have found this invaluable resource. Here's to many cancerversaries for us all! Cindy
Posts.Title: CALLING ALL STAGE I SISTERS sheila888 MCBaker

Posts.Content: May 5, 2010 10:22AM CindyC9437 wrote: lil-wilde, I had the painful goosebumps for weeks after MX.  I am not just over 8 weeks out and it has only happened a couple of times in the past month.  I was thinking it was just the nerve endings repairing themselves, but it drove me nuts.  Hope it gets better for you soon.  Cindy
